column1: 11$Condition: Posttraumatic Stress Syndrome$3/9/2019 12:19:49 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been using this medication in combination with prazosin to treat PTSD and related symptoms. I'm also recovering from long term drug and alcohol abuse. At first my primary care physician had me on Prozac which I only took for a few days because it seemed to have a paradoxical effect making my symptoms worse. So I returned to illegal drug use for over a year before returning to my PCP. This time around I was diagnosed with PTSD as opposed to the major depressive disorder I was currently diagnosed with. With this in mind my doctor prescribed mirtazapine in conjunction with the high blood pressure medication prazosin which has been shown to reduce nightmares in PTSD patients. I had terrible nightmares and was averaging about 2-3 hours of sleep a night if I was lucky. Once one the medication combination I was able to sleep for a solid 8 hours. I take it at about 9pm. It doesn't knock me out immediately. I can stay up an watch a movie if I like but if I get the slightest bit comfortable then I'm out. The first week I still woke up groggy and the nightmares started to change to just vivid dreams. I still have some but it is much less frequent and I have more control to simply open my eyes if it gets too rough. They seem to be waning off. I'm less irritable now and my blood pressure is finally getting under control since my stress is lower which was the main cause of my blood pressure issues according to my doctor.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$3$5$I've been taking the 30mg tablets for maybe 8 months now and they do what they're supposed to. I found it took a week or two to start getting used to them. They help with sleep maybe too much. They force me to sleep about 8 hours even through a couple alarm clocks going off by my head for a couple hours. I've stopped taking them before because of this and was fine for a couple days but found the littlest thing would set me off so I started taking a half a night for a couple nights and back to the full 30mg. I've been off them again now for about a week and the first couple days weren't bad but I'm finding now that the daily thoughts of suicide are coming back so I think tonight I'll start taking them again. I strongly recommend not trying to take yourself off of these pills without your docs approval. He said it usually takes 9 months to cure depression but I think it may take a bit longer so be patient. Try getting to bed at least 8 hours before you're supposed to be up. They take maybe about a half hour to an hour to start working but make sure you don't have to do anything after you've taken them because they knock me right out cold. I've found that they do increase your appetite and you may gain a few pounds but chances are you'll lose it pretty fast after your treatment. Just being off of them for a week I've found that I'm not as hungry and probably have lost 2 or 3 pounds but losing the few pounds isn't worth taking the chance of worsening your depression. Hope this helps but please for the sake of yourself and the people in your life
column3: don't stop taking them until your doctor thinks you're ready to.
